Description: Fragment of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Flattened handle to sharpish turn. Rectangular stamp. Clay fine buff.
Production date: 152 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Probably drawn by Petrie (Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p..110, 28). Name Pausanias. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 475.43?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0964)
